Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Prophenin-2 (PF-2, natural AMPs; Pro-rich, PrAMPs; cathelicidin, pigs, mammals; animals; XXA. 80-residue Variants: PF-2-Pyr or PF-2-Gln)

Literature Information.Literature: Prophenin (PF) and variants thereof are also found in organic extracts of porcine pulmonary tissue (Wang Y. et al. FEBS Lett. 1999; 460: 257). The major forms of PF found in these extracts by nano-ES mass spectrometry are the 80-residue polypeptides prophenin-2-Pyr (PF-2-Pyr) and prophenin-2-Gln (PF-2-Gln). Prophenin-2-Pyr is refractory to Edman degradation due to the presence of an N-terminal pyroglutamic residue. In PF-2-Gln the N-terminal residue is glutamine and the C-terminus is amidated.
Literature Information.Author: Zhao C, Ganz T, Lehrer RI.1995
Literature Information.Title: Structures of genes for two cathelin-associated antimicrobial peptides: prophenin-2 and PR-39.
